css.questionText: If we want define style for an unique element, then which css selector will we use ?
css.explanation: TS uses a colon (:) to separate the property name from the property type

css.questionText: If we don't want to allow a floating div to the left side of an element, which css property will we use
css.explanation: enum is not used as a type in TypeScript

css.questionText: If we want to wrap a block of text around an image, which css property will we use ?
css.explanation: interfaces are typically used to list the properties and methods for an object

css.questionText: How else can Array<number> be written in CSS?
css.explanation: number[] is another way of writing Array<number> in TypeScript

css.questionText: In which of these does a class take parameters?
css.explanation: a constructor is used by a class to take in parameters

css.questionText: f we want to show an Arrow as cursor, then which value we will use ?
css.explanation: async is not used as an access modifier type in TypeScript

css.questionText: If we want to use a nice looking green dotted border around an image, which css property will we use?
css.explanation: the export keyword allows for the information to be transmitted between files

css.questionText: Which is an array method to generate a new array based on a condition?
css.explanation: filter is a method used to conditionally create a new array

css.questionText: How is a property accessible within a class?
css.explanation: this.propertyName is the way to access a specific property within a class
